documents.title: The Future of Music is Electronic
documents.description: Why we're running out of traditional melodies and how software-modified timbre opens an infinite frontier for musical creation.
documents.content:
*Big thanks to my brother, Cortland, on the help writing this. Cortland is currently pursuing an advanced degree in music theory and helped make sure I wasn't completely wrong here, only mostly.*

documents.title: Hello World: Building The Control Room
documents.description: An introduction to this site and what I hope to accomplish.
documents.content:
# Hello World

This is the first essay on The Control Room. Welcome.

## Why Build This

I wanted a space that felt like *mine* — a place to think in public, share ideas, and connect them together. So

documents.title: How I Became a Christian
documents.description: A rationalist's journey to faith—from southern Baptist childhood to angry atheism to genuine belief.
documents.content: I became a Christian this weekend. Trust me, I'm just as surprised by this news as you are. I want to share how I got here and where my conviction came from, not for the typical "share your testimony

documents.title: Peer-Reviewed Academic Paper on Prospera Governance
documents.description: A peer-reviewed paper on the history, formation, and governance structure of Honduras's first ZEDE.
documents.content: A few years ago, I wrote a peer reviewed academic paper about the history, formation, and governance structure of Prospera. Sadly, the journal in which I published it seems to have shuttered, meaning

documents.title: The Voluntaryist Constitution
documents.description: A theoretical framework for constitutional governance based on voluntary association, consent, and the protection of individual rights.
documents.content:
*Originally published on [Mises Wire](https://mises.org/mises-wire/voluntaryist-constitution).*

This essay presents a theoretical framework for what a constitution designed around purely voluntary pr

documents.title: Note from 2024-01-10
documents.content: Setting up this site and thinking through how I want to structure my digital garden. The key insight: don't overthink it. Start writing, let the structure emerge.

documents.title: The Network State
documents.content: Balaji's book on network states is a fascinating thought experiment. Whether or not you agree with the conclusions, it forces you to think differently about sovereignty, community, and digital coordin

documents.title: The Problem of Political Authority
documents.content: A rigorous philosophical examination of why governments claim authority and whether those claims are justified. Changed how I think about legitimacy.

documents.title: The Machinery of Freedom
documents.content: A practical exploration of how a stateless society might function. Friedman's economic approach to anarchism is uniquely compelling.

documents.title: Seeing Like a State
documents.content: Essential reading for anyone interested in governance. Scott's concept of 'metis' and critique of high-modernist planning is profound.

documents.title: Antifragile
documents.content: Taleb's framework for things that gain from disorder. The concept of antifragility has shaped how I think about building resilient systems.

documents.title: The Sovereign Individual
documents.description: by James Dale Davidson & Lord William Rees-Mogg (1997)
keywords: James Dale Davidson & Lord William Rees-Mogg

documents.title: Stubborn Attachments
documents.content: The moral case for economic growth as a near-sacred duty. Cowen argues that maximizing sustainable growth is the most ethical thing we can do for future generations—a belief I hold deeply.

documents.title: The Beginning of Infinity
documents.content: On my list because of its exploration of the power of explanatory knowledge. Deutsch's optimism about human potential is inspiring.

The Control Room
documents.description: An explorable index of ideas, writing, and reading.
documents.content: Personal knowledge and public writing are scattered across tools and feeds. Build a command-palette-first site that ties essays, notes, books, and a knowledge graph into one place.
